Dispute_Type: Discrimination and Harassment based on sex and disability
Legal_Issue: Whether the Canadian Human Rights Commission erred in dismissing the complaint without considering all circumstances
Evidence_Assessment: Commission reviewed investigator's report and submissions; applicant provided detailed rebuttal
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate grounds for inquiry
Credibility_Factor: Applicant alleged bias and inadequate investigation
Legal_Rule: Under s. 44(3)(b)(i) of the Canadian Human Rights Act, the Commission may dismiss a complaint if an inquiry is not warranted
Procedural_Issue: Alleged failure to consider all circumstances and procedural fairness
Grounds_for_Claim: Discrimination based on sex and disability
Review_Standard: Whether Commission erred procedurally or substantively
Key_Evidence_Considered: Investigator's report, applicant's submissions and rebuttal
Applicant_Challenge: Commission dismissed complaint without full consideration, alleged bias
Legal_Provision: s. 44(3)(b)(i) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Applicable_Process: Human rights complaint process followed by judicial review
